caption: Table 1: Comparison with related works on offline RL under model mismatch. In [5], Cob is the robust partial coverage coefficient [5], which is similar to Cπ*, and the exp((1 – γ)−1) term can be eliminated with an additional cost on Pmin−1 and μmin−1.
description: This table compares the sample complexities of three different offline reinforcement learning (RL) methods under three different divergence measures (Total Variation, Chi-squared, and Kullback-Leibler).  It highlights the improvements achieved by the proposed unified framework in terms of sample complexity compared to previous state-of-the-art methods. The table showcases the trade-off between the complexity of handling data sparsity and model mismatch.
